text:

What I'd like to do is have the navigation buttons open the forms that I've made ( I need to work on these more and get those % out but I can't seem to get them to work correctly). I don't have the best terminology for googling communicating so Hopefully this makes sense...

I just started working with python yesterday so please cut me some slack and send me some links for tutorials and textbooks I'm trying to get better.

    import tkinter as tk
    
    class Clients:
        def __init__(self, master):
            self.master = master
            self.frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
            self.button1 = tk.Button(self.frame, text = 'Clients', width = 25, command = self.new_window)
            self.button1.pack()
            self.frame.pack()
    
        def new_window(self):
            self.newWindow = tk.Toplevel(self.master)
            self.app = Computers(self.newWindow)
    
    class Computers:
        def __init__(self, master):
            self.master = master
            self.frame = tk.Frame(self.master)
            self.quitButton = tk.Button(self.frame, text = 'Quit', width = 25, command = self.close_windows)
            self.quitButton.pack()
            self.frame.pack()
    
        def close_windows(self):
            self.master.destroy()
    
    def main(): 
        root = tk.Tk()
        app = Clients(root)
        root.mainloop()
    
    if __name__ == '__main__':
        main()
